title: Wrongfully Banned

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
I realize I died a whole bunch, but I wasn't intentionally feeding. I was just playing a norm game with my bf and when the game loaded my resolution wasn't right and it was cutting off the bottom of the screen (I couldn't see my skill bar, chatbox, or mini map. (We fixed it afterwards, turned out to be a TV setting). I tried to do the best that I could as Riven, but once you fall behind it is hard to catch up. My bf even told everyone in game it was a resolution issue and even died while afk under the turret trying to fix it (he was playing as Lux). I feel like I would have been better off leaving the game once I fell so far behind as I most likely wouldn't have been banned or would have been banned for a shorter duration. Is that the lesson Riot is trying to teach? I feel pretty bad about this because I never say anything mean in chat I just try to do a good job playing. I used to play ranked (climbed from bronze to silver last season) but the people in game would get so mad when we lost that I started to only play norms as I just like having fun playing with my bf. My best friend just ordered a laptop and the three of us were hoping to all play together when it comes in the mail, and now I got a 14 day ban :(

If you look at last few minutes of the game Ziggs wasn't even fighting anymore even though the rest of us tried until the end. Why doesn't he get a ban for giving up while I get a ban for trying? Perhaps the auto ban system shouldn't apply to feeding cases since sometimes players report feeding on someone who is having a bad game.

replies.body:
Hooray Riot fixed it!!!! They also reminded me about the remake function. I'll be reading up on it for sure before I start another game in case any other technical issues happen. I did fix the resolution one though. My bf found a "fit to screen" option hidden in the settings. I need to work on not feeding when I fall behind next time in a tough lane match up. I had never seen a Tristana top before and had no idea how to deal with her range, damage, and that frustrating escape. 

Thanks everyone for the morale support. I always feel like the internet is full of trolls but you guys were all quite polite and understanding of my situation. Back to the fields of justice, mreaow!

1st blood 2:40
next death of yours
not even before 4 min marker
5;30 3rd death
6;30 4th
5-6- prior to 8 min mark

I don't need to continue, pretty much followers that pattern
this would appear to be intent feeding, you clearly did not change you play style to resolve the differences.
You walked into lane died, respawned, walked into lane and died
That is how it looks
regardless of it you intended to do it or not
You're a moron, plain and simple.

> [{quoted}](name=Bôôsted Bonobo,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=TalXAkt3,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2017-02-06T21:14:34.397+0000)
>
> You're a moron, plain and simple.

zzz? how so?

The notion you think this person was intentionally feeding, when clearly they were not. It looks like a very bad game, and a very bad matchup. Considering they are newer to league, playing normals, and playing a champion like riven, shows that they just didn't get the matchup and didn't know how to play the lane. Looking at the match history of this player, they clearly obviously try to win their games (and win a good margin), and I don't see ANY indication of purposeful feeding.

Get off your high horse and realize people have bad games, yes, even like this.

> [{quoted}](name=Bôôsted Bonobo,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=TalXAkt3,comment-id=0006000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-06T21:19:25.420+0000)
>
> The notion you think this person was intentionally feeding, when clearly they were not. It looks like a very bad game, and a very bad matchup. Considering they are newer to league, playing normals, and playing a champion like riven, shows that they just didn't get the matchup and didn't know how to play the lane. Looking at the match history of this player, they clearly obviously try to win their games (and win a good margin), and I don't see ANY indication of purposeful feeding.
> 
> Get off your high horse and realize people have bad games, yes, even like this.


i'd like to point out what I said, again just to be clear
Where did I say he was feeding
"appear to be intent feeding"- note the word appear
-seem; give the impression of being.
I stated what it looked like, I made no judgement about weather he did or didn't aim to win.
It is very apparent he died alot and in rapid succession
if you please can show me where I came off
 as he intent fed, therefore punishment is correct, I wish to clear this error up
As, I do think he had a bad game.


"1st blood 2:40
next death of yours
not even before 4 min marker
5;30 3rd death
6;30 4th
5-6- prior to 8 min mark

I don't need to continue, pretty much followers that pattern
this would appear to be intent feeding, you clearly did not change you play style to resolve the differences.
You walked into lane died, respawned, walked into lane and died
That is how it looks
regardless of it you intended to do it or not"

It follows a pattern of... she had a bad matchup and does poorly on riven overall. You don't get punished for having a bad game, which this was. It wasn't intentional feeding. It may have been feeding, but not intentional. Hence, not a reportable or bannable offense.

> [{quoted}](name=Bôôsted Bonobo,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=TalXAkt3,comment-id=000600000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-06T22:20:03.550+0000)
>
> It follows a pattern of... she had a bad matchup and does poorly on riven overall. You don't get punished for having a bad game, which this was. It wasn't intentional feeding. It may have been feeding, but not intentional. Hence, not a reportable or bannable offense.

Again, show me where I state in my original post where I made the claim that Op was intentionally feeding??

"1st blood 2:40
next death of yours
not even before 4 min marker
5;30 3rd death
6;30 4th
5-6- prior to 8 min mark

I don't need to continue, pretty much followers that pattern
this would appear to be intent feeding, you clearly did not change you play style to resolve the differences.
You walked into lane died, respawned, walked into lane and died
That is how it looks
regardless of it you intended to do it or not"

The pattern I was referencing was the fact op died on avg less than 2 mins 
"You walked into lane died, respawned, walked into lane and died" which again I state directly after I declared a pattern in the game
again I ask where Did I state OP was intent feeding and deserves the punishment.
At some point people have to be held accountable for their "bad games".
What? No. Idiot. You don't get punished for having bad games. If that were the case, 99% of you here would be banned already.

Thats the exact problem I'm talking about. You can go have a game just like the Op did in Ranked and avoid all punishment due to "just a bad game". At some point, players need to held accountable for feeding whether it was done intentionally or not, which isn't something that can be easily proven anyway.
Players should ONLY be held accountable for intentional feeding. Unintentional feeding = bad game. How hard is that to understand?
lol you arent gonna get a 14 day ban for feeding even if it was intentional

I did get a 14 day ban for one game of feeding unintentionally. Looking at my match history you can tell I have actually been playing pretty well and it is the only game where I fed pretty hard, yet I got a 14 day ban. I don't type into chat (my bf types from his account because typing in game distracts me), so there is no other reason for it. They also described it as intentional feeding.

http://imgur.com/a/Rc3Du
LOL thats the first punishment you get for feeding .. why do you even talk without any idea WHAT you are saying?
What sort of ban did you get? Was it LeaverBuster, or was it a different behavioral suspension?
I mean she said it was a "14 day ban" so...
Im sorry but you should never die 15 times in 20 min....that's very very bad
Based on the map of deaths, it doesn't look like inting to me

Definitely talk with riot support and insist on getting a real person higher up in the chain. Usually they just spam you with automated messages about bans. Thankfully it was just a 2-week ban and not a perma... but this definitely isn't ban worthy whatsoever. You clearly weren't int feeding, just having a bad game. I've seen the rest of your games and while not great, you have wins/losses just like anyone else.

Riot is a piece of shit automated company lately.
15 deaths in 20 minutes. Now that's impressive -- you can argue against it but even with a cut screen it's a huge red flag for intentionally feeding.

Make a support ticket asking politely for them to review your case. Do not add information to it, that puts you at the end of the queue.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us

I already submitted a ticket last night, but I did not see a spot for ban review so I submitted it to another category.  I appreciate what they are trying to do as I have played with a few rammus powerball mid to feed players and it is nice they are doing something about it. 14 days seems quite harsh especially given it catches some of us who simply played bad for one game.

I believe it was a rioter that said the amount of times someone gets punished improperly (either because they did not deserve to be punished or was punished too severely) is 1 in 10,000. I don't have a link for that, but if you care to look it up I think it was Tantrum that said it.

Personally, I think 14 day suspension into perma is neither too harsh nor not harsh enough. The first punishment gets the point across and the second means they learned nothing.

GL with your ticket.
I normally do a lot better but between the resolution issue and going against tristana, I got wrecked.

> [{quoted}](name=blookitty,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=TalXAkt3,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-02-06T09:45:37.678+0000)
>
> I normally do a lot better but between the resolution issue and going against tristana, I got wrecked.

Note though that they never ban especially in these cases from just one game. Just like everything else it needs to be consistent.
Look at my match history. I have been playing pretty well lately and haven't fed at all.

> [{quoted}](name=blookitty,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=TalXAkt3,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2017-02-06T10:12:03.302+0000)
>
> Look at my match history. I have been playing pretty well lately and haven't fed at all.

Again its hard to say because we can only see your end game stats, for all we know those death could have you just walking up to the enemy, or you could have just gotten outplayed in lane. we (the community) dont know since we can only go by the stats, whereas someone at Riot more than likely watched your games and came to determine that you were intentionally feeding.

You have to be a blind leper with down syndrome to think this person was int feeding. Looking at her match history, it's VERY clear they are trying to win and playing the game as intended. In NORMALS. One bad game on riven =/= int feeding.

I mean its really hard to say since we can only go by your end game stats. But you seem to go into the double digits in death for a 30min games. Nothing wrong with that, but that could see you as feeding especially if you do it in a lot of your games. Not too sure how they figure out who intentionally feeds, but if anything you can always contact Support and see if they can give you more information on the matter!

"Intentional feeding" research is supposed to take into account game history as well. So if they continually surpass X_amount of deaths in a x-minute game, then the algorithm is supposed to consider that as normal for that player. 

But we all know how well Riot's shit works as intended...
It simply said 14 Day suspension and a player triggered review found you were intentionally feeding.

Every time I see a post like this, its in a Normal game. Very disappointing. I really wish Riot would start banning people for doing this in Ranked. Banning people for two weeks for feeding in a Normal blind pick game is just silly. Who the hell even cares?
